result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey J Riley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant may petition Court in writing, after two years, upon successful completion of probation, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and costs paid in full.
Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Complete domestic abuse counseling, absolute sobriety at all times.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:10 A.M., Defendant, Casey J Riley, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Kohlwey makes statement re: victim notification, defendant would like to proceed w/out counsel, defendant requesting expunction, State objects to expunction, defendant did not meet all conditions, Court denies expunction, 11:23 A.M.
from DA Kohlwey opposing defendant's request for expunction
Request to DA Kohlwey re: input on expungement
Certificate of Discharge and Satisfaction of Probation conditions for Expungement filed by Probation Agent Joshua Champion
Letter to defendant requesting form DOC 2678 to process expungement request
Request to Expunge filed by defendant
Defendant to be discharged from probation on 8-22-16; unpaid court obligations of $501.24
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Casey J Riley in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to counts 2&3. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 yrs. probation, $543 costs on each count, Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Complete domestic abuse counseling, absolute sobriety at all times. Defendant may petition Court in writing, after 2 yrs, upon successful completion of probation,  for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and costs paid in full. 2 days  jail credit. Ct. 1 read in and dismissed.
Copy of discovery letter from DA Kohlwey to Atty Lawton
Copy of discovery letter from DA Kohlwey to Attorney Lawton
and Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by DA Jane Kohlwey

records.addlTxt: No contact with L.B. or her residence, or her place of employment.  Not to possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  Standard felony conditions.

Defendant Casey J Riley by video, in custody with attorney Roger L Klopp.  Jane E Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $500.00 signature bond.  No contact with L.B. or her residence, or her place of employment.  Not to possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  Standard felony conditions.  Waives time limits.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 09:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
